elements.description:
`furo-ui5-pagination-bar`
this pagination element loops the hts array and find out the pagination
information like prev, next, first and last


Tags: pagination

methods.name: inject
methods.description: init pagination attributes

methods.name: getCurrentPage
methods.description: get current page number via self link: page=xx

elements.name: FuroUi5PaginationBar

events.name: pagination-first
events.description:
pagination-first
Is fired if the pagination button 'sys_first_page' was clicked

events.name: pagination-last
events.description:
pagination-last
Is fired if the pagination button 'sys_last_page' was clicked

events.name: pagination-next
events.description:
pagination-next
Is fired if the pagination button 'sys_next_page' was clicked

events.name: pagination-prev
events.description:
pagination-prev
Is fired if the pagination button 'sys_prev_page' was clicked

elements.description:
`furo-ui5-data-input`
The furo-ui5-data-input is the base component for all furo-ui5-data-input components.
DO NOT USE DIRECTLY

properties.name: ui5Icon
properties.description: Set the ui5 icon

properties.name: _error
properties.description: sets and remove the error state

properties.name: _errorMsg
properties.description: store the error message and update the value state message

properties.name: _informationMsg
properties.description: store the information message and update the value state message

properties.name: _warningMsg
properties.description: store the warning message and update the value state message

properties.name: _successMsg
properties.description: store the success message and update the value state message

properties.name: _valueState
properties.description: Update the value state on change

properties.name: _hint
properties.description: Sets the title attribute when hint is given, because ui5 only shows the messages when valueState is not None

properties.name: suggestions
properties.description:
set suggestions as the ui5-suggestion-item element
sample data of the suggestions: [{"text":"Spain","icon":"world","type":"Active","infoState":"None","group":false,"key":0},.. ]
if the suggestion item has icon , the ui5 icons should be imported in your ui component

methods.name: _initBinder
methods.description:
inits the universalFieldNodeBinder.
Set the mapped attributes and labels.

methods.name: applyBindingSet
methods.description: apply the binding set to the universal field node binder

methods.name: setValue
methods.description: Sets the value for the field. This will update the fieldNode.

methods.name: bindData
methods.description:
Bind a entity field to the text-input. You can use the entity even when no data was received.
When you use `@-object-ready` from a `furo-data-object` which emits a EntityNode, just bind the field with `--entity(*.fields.fieldname)`

methods.name: _setValueStateMessage
methods.description: Updates the vs and creates the element in the slot on demand

elements.name: FuroUi5DataInput

elements.description:
The ui5-input component allows the user to enter and edit text.
Additionally, you can provide suggestionItems, that are displayed in a popover right under the input.

The text field can be editable or read-only (readonly property), and it can be enabled or disabled (enabled property).
To visualize semantic states, such as "error" or "warning", the valueState property is provided.
When the user makes changes to the text, the change event is fired, which enables you to react on any text change.

elements.name: FuroUi5DataTextInput

events.name: change
events.description: Fired when the input operation has finished by pressing Enter or on focusout.

events.name: input
events.description: Fired when the value of the furo-ui5-data-text-input changes at each keystroke, and when a suggestion item has been selected.

events.name: submit
events.description:
Fired when user presses Enter key on the ui5-input.
Note: The event is fired independent of whether there was a change before or not. If change was performed,
the event is fired after the change event. The event is also fired when an item of the select list is selected by pressing Enter.

events.name: suggestion-item-preview
events.description: Fired when the user navigates to a suggestion item via the ARROW keys, as a preview, before the final selection.

events.name: suggestion-item-select
events.description: Fired when a suggestion item, that is displayed in the suggestion popup, is selected.

events.name: suggestion-scroll
events.description: Fired when the user scrolls the suggestion popover.

elements.description:
`furo-ui5-data-collection-dropdown`
The furo-ui5-data-collection-dropdown component represents a drop-down menu with a list of the available options and
a text input field to narrow down the options. It is commonly used to enable users to select one or more options from a predefined list.

Structure
The furo-ui5-data-collection-dropdown consists of the following elements:
 - Input field - displays the selected option or a custom user entry. Users can type to narrow down the list or enter their own value.
 - Drop-down arrow - expands\collapses the option list.
 - Option list - the list of available options.

Keyboard Handling
The furo-ui5-data-collection-dropdown provides advanced keyboard handling.
Picker
If the ui5-combobox is focused, you can open or close the drop-down by pressing F4, ALT+UP or ALT+DOWN keys.

properties.name: list
properties.description:
Set a string list as options:

"A, B, C"

This will convert to options ["A","B","C"] by furo-select-input

properties.name: subfield
properties.description:
if you bind a complex type, declare here the field which gets updated of value by selecting an item.

If you bind a scalar, you dont need this attribute.

properties.name: subfieldDisplay
properties.description:
if you bind a complex type, declare here the field which gets updated of display_name by selecting an item.

If you bind a scalar, you dont need this attribute.

properties.name: displayField
properties.description: The name of the field from the injected collection that contains the label for the dropdown array.

properties.name: valueField
properties.description: The name of the field from the injected collection that contains the value you want to assign to the attribute value and the bounded field.

properties.name: hint
properties.description:
Overrides the hint text from the **specs**.

Use with caution, normally the specs defines this value.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: A Boolean attribute which, if present, means this field cannot be edited by the user.

properties.name: autofocus
properties.description: Set this attribute to autofocus the input field.

properties.name: leadingIcon
properties.description: Icon on the left side

properties.name: trailingIcon
properties.description: Icon on the right side

properties.name: valid
properties.description: html input validity

properties.name: condensed
properties.description: The default style (md like) supports a condensed form. It is a little bit smaller then the default

properties.name: _dropdownList
properties.description: the dropdown list

properties.name: multiple
properties.description: multiple selection mark

properties.name: size
properties.description: the size of multiple selection

properties.name: _writeLock
properties.description: A Boolean attribute which, if present, means this field is not writeable for a while.

methods.name: _initBinder
methods.description:
inits the universalFieldNodeBinder.
Set the mapped attributes and labels.

methods.name: setOptions
methods.description: Set the options programmatically

methods.name: disable
methods.description: Sets the field to readonly

methods.name: enable
methods.description: Makes the field writable.

methods.name: bindData
methods.description:
Bind a entity field to the range-input. You can use the entity even when no data was received.
When you use `@-object-ready` from a `furo-data-object` which emits a EntityNode, just bind the field with `--entity(*.fields.fieldname)`

methods.name: _checkIsComplexType
methods.description: eslint-disable-next-line class-methods-use-this

methods.name: setValue
methods.description: Sets the value for the field. This will update the fieldNode.

methods.name: _updateField
methods.description: eslint-disable-next-line class-methods-use-this

methods.name: _parseRepeatedData
methods.description: change the value data of repeated field to an array according to the defined subfield likes `data.id`

methods.name: _buildListWithMetaOptions
methods.description: Build the dropdown list with given options from meta

methods.name: injectList
injectEntities
methods.description: Inject the array with entities for the selectable options.

elements.name: FuroUi5DataCollectionDropdown

attributes.name: list
attributes.description:
Set a string list as options:

"A, B, C"

This will convert to options ["A","B","C"] by furo-select-input

attributes.name: subfield
attributes.description:
if you bind a complex type, declare here the field which gets updated of value by selecting an item.

If you bind a scalar, you dont need this attribute.

attributes.name: subfield-display
attributes.description:
if you bind a complex type, declare here the field which gets updated of display_name by selecting an item.

If you bind a scalar, you dont need this attribute.

attributes.name: display-field
attributes.description: The name of the field from the injected collection that contains the label for the dropdown array.

attributes.name: value-field
attributes.description: The name of the field from the injected collection that contains the value you want to assign to the attribute value and the bounded field.

attributes.name: hint
attributes.description:
Overrides the hint text from the **specs**.

Use with caution, normally the specs defines this value.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: A Boolean attribute which, if present, means this field cannot be edited by the user.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: Set this attribute to autofocus the input field.

attributes.name: condensed
attributes.description: The default style (md like) supports a condensed form. It is a little bit smaller then the default

events.name: item-selected
events.description:
item-selected
Fired when a item from the dropdown was selected

detail payload: the original item object or the array of original item objects by multiple options

events.name: value-changed
events.description:
value-changed
Fired when value has changed from the component inside.

detail payload: {*} the value from the value-field. By default the value field is "id"

*bubbles**
